store.name: WellRest Sleep Shop
store.description: Your destination for sleep wellness products

products.name: Basic Melatonin 3mg
review_samples: Works great for occasional sleeplessness. Simple and effective.
Best value melatonin I've found. No reason to pay more.
Take it maybe twice a week when I can't sleep. Does the job.

products.name: Melatonin 3mg Fast Dissolve
review_samples: Love not needing water. Keep these on my nightstand.
Pleasant mint taste, works within 20 minutes.
Perfect for travel. Simple and effective.

products.name: Melatonin 1mg Low Dose
review_samples: Perfect for sensitive people. 3mg was too much for me.
Research shows lower doses often work better. This is ideal.
Gentle and effective. No grogginess.

products.name: Melatonin 5mg
warnings: Higher dose - start with half tablet
review_samples: Good for people who need a bit more. I have delayed sleep phase.
Too strong for occasional use but good for my chronic issues.
Started with 3mg, moved up to this. Works for my severe insomnia.

products.name: Melatonin 10mg Maximum Strength
warnings: High dose - not for occasional sleeplessness
May cause significant drowsiness and vivid dreams
review_samples: Only for severe insomnia. Way too much for most people.
My doctor recommended this dose for my shift work disorder.
Knocked me out but felt hungover. Went back to 3mg.
Research shows higher isn't better for most. This is overkill.

products.name: Sleep Gummies Berry
review_samples: Taste great and work well. My favorite way to take melatonin.
Kids love these (gave them half dose). Adults too!
Good for people who hate pills. Gentle formula.

products.name: Sleep Gummies Sugar-Free
warnings: Sugar alcohols may cause digestive discomfort
review_samples: Finally a sugar-free option that doesn't taste awful.
Good for diabetics. Works as well as regular gummies.
Slight aftertaste from stevia but effective.

products.name: Valerian Root 450mg
warnings: May interact with sedatives and alcohol
review_samples: Traditional herb that works. Helps me relax before bed.
Doesn't work for everyone but great for me.
Smells bad but effective. Good for anxiety-related sleep issues.

products.name: Chamomile Extract 500mg
warnings: May cause allergic reaction in people allergic to ragweed
review_samples: Like drinking chamomile tea in a pill. Gentle relaxation.
Mild but effective. Good for winding down.
Safe and natural. No grogginess.

products.name: Passionflower Extract 400mg
warnings: Consult doctor if pregnant or taking medications
review_samples: Helps with racing thoughts. Good for anxiety-related insomnia.
Gentle herb, no harsh effects.
Works well combined with melatonin.

products.name: Lemon Balm 500mg
review_samples: Calming without being sedating. Good for daytime anxiety too.
Subtle but helpful. Part of my nighttime routine.
Safe herb with good research behind it.

products.name: Magnesium Glycinate 400mg
warnings: High doses may cause digestive issues
review_samples: Best form of magnesium for sleep. Glycinate is gentle on stomach.
Helps with muscle relaxation and sleep. Two birds, one stone.
Many people are deficient in magnesium. This helped my sleep and leg cramps.

products.name: Magnesium L-Threonate 2000mg
review_samples: Premium magnesium that crosses blood-brain barrier. Pricey but worth it for me.
Honestly couldn't tell difference from regular magnesium glycinate.
Good for cognitive function, sleep benefits are secondary.
Very expensive for the amount of elemental magnesium you get.

products.name: Melatonin + Magnesium
review_samples: Great simple combo. The magnesium helps me relax, melatonin does the rest.
Two things that work well together. Good value.
Better than taking two separate pills.

products.name: Melatonin + L-Theanine
review_samples: L-theanine calms my mind, melatonin helps me drift off. Perfect combo.
Good for people with racing thoughts at night.
Simple and effective. These are the two ingredients that actually work.

products.name: Melatonin + Valerian
warnings: May interact with sedatives and alcohol
review_samples: Stronger than plain melatonin. Good for tougher sleep issues.
Valerian gives me weird dreams but the combo works.
Bit groggy in morning. Might be too strong for occasional use.

products.name: Sleep Support Complex
warnings: GABA may interact with blood pressure meds
review_samples: Good multi-ingredient formula without going overboard.
Four proven ingredients. Works well for me.
Effective but more than I need for occasional sleeplessness.

products.name: Calm & Sleep Formula
warnings: Contains multiple herbs - consult doctor if on medications
review_samples: Herbal blend approach. Gentle but effective.
Too many ingredients for my taste. Simple melatonin works same for me.
Nice if you like herbal supplements. Relaxing formula.

products.name: Deep Sleep Formula
warnings: Do not take with SSRIs or MAOIs due to 5-HTP
review_samples: Strong formula for serious sleep issues. Not for casual use.
Finally something that works for my chronic insomnia.
Too powerful for me. Felt hungover. Returned it.
The 5-HTP concerns me for regular use. Be careful mixing with meds.

products.name: DreamWell Premium Sleep
warnings: Do not take with SSRIs, SNRIs, or MAOIs
May cause drowsiness, vivid dreams, morning grogginess
Not for long-term daily use without supervision
review_samples: Premium price but works for my severe insomnia when nothing else did.
Overkill for most people. I have chronic issues so it's worth it.
Too many ingredients. Had side effects. Simple melatonin is better for occasional use.
Good but the 5-HTP worries me. Can't take with my antidepressant.

products.name: RestoreNight Elite
warnings: Serious drug interactions possible - consult doctor
Do not use with psychiatric medications
High ingredient load may cause digestive upset
review_samples: For severe chronic insomnia only. This is serious stuff.
Way too strong. Felt drugged the whole next day.
Works but the side effects aren't worth it. Went back to basics.
8 active ingredients when I just needed melatonin. Marketing hype.
Expensive and unnecessary for most sleep issues.

products.name: Ultimate Sleep System
warnings: Consult physician before use - high ingredient complexity
May cause headache, nausea, vivid dreams
review_samples: 11 ingredients is absurd. Marketing over science.
Made for people who think more = better. It's not.
Tried this when desperate. Worked but side effects were terrible.
My doctor said this is way more than anyone needs. Stick to basics.
Expensive and overcomplicated. Returned after one night of weird dreams and nausea.

products.name: Melatonin Oral Spray
review_samples: Absorbs faster than pills. Good for when I need to fall asleep quickly.
Easy to adjust dose. One spray is enough for me.
Convenient and portable. Great for travel.

products.name: Liquid Melatonin Drops
review_samples: Easy to adjust dose precisely. Good for people sensitive to melatonin.
Works fast since it's absorbed sublingually.
My kids can take a smaller dose. Very flexible.

products.name: Sleep Patches
warnings: Do not apply to broken skin
review_samples: Novel delivery method. Releases slowly throughout night.
Expensive and not more effective than pills for me.
Good if you have stomach issues with oral supplements.
Gimmicky. Just take a regular melatonin tablet.

products.name: Sleepy Time Herbal Tea
warnings: Contains herbs - consult doctor if pregnant
review_samples: Relaxing bedtime ritual. The routine helps as much as the herbs.
Gentle and pleasant. Good taste.
Mild effect but I enjoy the process of making tea before bed.

products.name: Store Brand Melatonin 3mg
review_samples: Cheapest option and works just as well as name brands.
Melatonin is melatonin. Don't overpay.
Best value. Same ingredient, fraction of the price.

products.name: Store Brand Sleep Gummies
review_samples: Same as the expensive gummy brands. Great value.
Taste good and work well. My go-to.
Why pay more for the same thing?

products.name: Kids Sleep Gummies
warnings: Keep out of reach of children - may look like candy
review_samples: Low dose appropriate for kids. Pediatrician approved.
Helps my 6 year old settle down for sleep.
Use occasionally for schedule disruptions. Works well.

products.name: CBD + Melatonin Sleep
review_samples: CBD helps my anxiety which helps my sleep. Good combo.
Expensive but CBD makes a difference for me.
Not sure the CBD adds much over plain melatonin honestly.
Be careful with drug tests if that's a concern.

products.name: Sleep Essentials Monthly Box
review_samples: Fun to try different products each month.
Hit or miss depending on what they send.
Prefer to just buy what I know works.
Good way to discover new products but pricey.

products.name: Sleep Starter Bundle
review_samples: Good value bundle to try different approaches.
The melatonin alone did the job. Didn't need the rest.
Nice gift option for someone with sleep issues.

products.name: Premium Sleep Collection

ingredients.name: Bundle includes
ingredients.amount: DreamWell Premium + Mag L-Threonate + Sleep Patches + Lavender Spray

review_samples: Expensive bundle of mostly unnecessary products.
Good if you want to try premium options.
Overkill. The basic melatonin works fine.
Bought as gift. Recipient said most products were too strong.

products.name: Lavender Sleep Spray
review_samples: Love spraying this on my pillow. Very relaxing scent.
Nice addition to bedtime routine. Not a miracle but pleasant.
Aromatherapy is subtle but I enjoy it.

products.name: White Noise Sleep Machine
review_samples: Blocks out street noise. Sleep much better now.
Multiple sound options. Love the rain sounds.
Good non-supplement option for sleep improvement.
